com.fortify.util.rest.query

Class AbstractRestConnectionQuery<ResponseType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fortify.util.rest.query.AbstractRestConnectionQuery<ResponseType>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRestConnectionQuery
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FoDEntityQuery, SSCEntityQuery

    public abstract class AbstractRestConnectionQuery<ResponseType>
extends Object
implements IRestConnectionQuery

    This abstract class provides an implementation for IRestConnectionQuery to allow for querying REST API's. Usually for each target system, you would have one (or a limited number of) concrete implementations of this class. These concrete implementations will need to implement and override various methods to handle things like paging (updatePagingDataFromResponse(PagingData, Object) and updateWebTargetWithPagingData(WebTarget, PagingData), and getting the necessary JSONList instance from the REST response (getResponseTypeClass() and getJSONListFromResponse(Object).

    This class is configured through a AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder instance, which allows for configuring the various details for building the actual REST requests and processing responses. This includes IWebTargetUpdater instances for generating the actual REST request, and IJSONMapPreProcessor instances for pre-processing each individual JSONMap instance returned by the REST request.

    Author:
    Ruud Senden

      • processAll

        public void processAll(IJSONMapProcessor processor)
        Description copied from interface: IRestConnectionQuery
        Process all results from the REST API call. For large result sets, this method usually provides better performance and requires less memory than the IRestConnectionQuery.getAll() method.
        Specified by:
        processAll in interface IRestConnectionQuery
        Parameters:
        processor - used to process the results

      • getUnique

        public JSONMap getUnique()
        Description copied from interface: IRestConnectionQuery
        Get a unique result from the REST API call. If there are no results, null will be returned. If there is more than one result, an exception will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        getUnique in interface IRestConnectionQuery
        Returns:
        Unique result from the REST API call

      • getWebTarget

        protected final javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget getWebTarget()

      • executeRequest

        protected ResponseType executeRequest(javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget target)

      • updatePagingDataFromResponse

        protected void updatePagingDataFromResponse(PagingData pagingData,
                                            ResponseType responseData)
        This method must be overridden by all implementations that support paging, to update the PagingData object with information from the last request, for example the total number of available results. This method is only called if this class is configured with pagingSupported==true.
        Parameters:
        pagingData - PagingData instance to be updated
        responseData - containing information to update the given PagingData instance

      • updateWebTargetWithPagingData

        protected javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget updateWebTargetWithPagingData(javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget target,
                                                                     PagingData pagingData)
        This method must be overridden by all implementations that support paging, to add information about page start and size to the request. This method is only called if this class is configured with pagingSupported==true.
        Parameters:
        target - WebTarget to be updated with given PagingData, for example to set start and limit request parameters
        pagingData - containing information to update the given WebTarget instance
        Returns:
        Updated WebTarget

        protected abstract Class<ResponseType> getResponseTypeClass()

      • getJSONListFromResponse

        protected abstract JSONList getJSONListFromResponse(ResponseType responseData)
        This method must be implemented by subclasses to get a JSONList instance from the response data.
        Parameters:
        responseData - from which to retrieve the JSONList instance
        Returns:
        JSONList containing array entries returned by a REST endpoint
